title.narrative: IYCF PRACTICES

description.narrative: Enhanced knowledge in 80% of targeted communities for improved Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) practices for children under-2 years in prioritized localities., which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially adolescents (both boys and girls), families and communities in the most deprived localities are resilient and adopt appropriate practices to reduce their vulnerability.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced knowledge in 80% of targeted communities for improved IYCF practices for children under-2 years in prioritizedlocalities.

description.narrative: During the country program UNICEF supported the establishment of 3000 community-based Mothers Support Groups (MSGs) in prioritized localities to provide interpersonal counselling of caregivers on good Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF), care and hygiene practices. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018
